page.title: 02Charity Farm
page.content: {Charity farm}is owned by Mr. Cooper and is mainly an arable farm although 90 breeding ewes are kept near-by. The farm came by its name because it belonged to a Charity Trust. The profits were used to shoe children in Boreham school and Little Baddow also. Nowadays the whole farm is worked by 3 men and an 18 year old boy.The farm comprises 208 acres, 60 acres of wheat, 100 acres of oil seed rape with barley making up the rest. The hard wheat is ground to make flour and the soft wheat is used for animal fodder. Beyond the house, which was rebuilt in 1803, lies two ponds. One drains to the River Crouch and the other to the River Blackwater. The main enemies on the farm are broom grass and a bug which burrows into the rape pods. The crops are sprayed 3 times a year to kill pests.
